channel.title: People can't connect to my rsps
channel.description:
Hello guys!
So i've portforwarded, i go on canyouseeme.org it says succes! Everything works fine, i can connec t with my local host, but people can not connect to my no-ip I've done the firewall thing, the path and classpath? i did everything... it still says error connecting to server?
Please leave a message! Already thanks!

item.source: People can't connect to my rsps

item.title: People can't connect to my rsps
item.dc:creator: @lardain lardain
item.description:
@lardain wrote:

Ill be glad to help you. First of all, make sure the client actually connects to port 43594 and not to 43595. Some people actually make 43595 as their hosting port. If thats not the problem be sure you portforwarded it the right way. If you are using a vps it would be in the inbound rules or outbound rules. Not sure about one of these 2. Look in the client. It might be that you changed the wrong ip. Look if there is no other ip set to 0.0.0.0 or 127.0.0.1 or localhost. Look on canyouseemee if the port is visible. If it is not you didn`t portforwarded the right way. Hope this helped you a little bit.

Read full topic

item.title: People can't connect to my rsps
item.dc:creator: @OhhStupid OhhStupid
item.description:
@OhhStupid wrote:

If you’re using no-ip, make sure you downloaded DUC from there website, and if you did that you should select the no-ip addess you’re using to host your server on, and you have to leave DUC open to be able to host.

Read full topic
